intro: Hypocyrta macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf hypocris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, often with a fragrant scent. Hypocyrta macrophylla is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
